# Heteroskedastizität
Ist dies und das
```{r}
n <- 100
x <- runif(n, min = 0, max = 10)
u <- rnorm(n, mean = 0, sd = .5 * x)
y <- 1 + 2*x + u
plot(x,y)
```

# Autokorrelation der Residuen
Bli Bla Blup
```{r}
n <- 100
x <- seq(from = 0, to = 10, length.out = n)
u <- numeric(n)
u[1] <- 0
for(i in 2:n) {
  u[i] <- 0.8*u[i-1] + rnorm(n = 1, mean = 0, sd = 1)
}
y <- 1 + 2*x + u

data.frame(x,y) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x ,y))+
  geom_line()+
  geom_abline(intercept = 1, slope = 2)
```

# Keine Autokorrelation (zum Vergleich)
Und noch was cooles :)
```{r}
n <- 100
x <- seq(from = 0, to = 10, length.out = n)
u <- rnorm(n, mean = 0, sd = 3)
y <- 1 + 2*x + u

data.frame(x,y) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x, y))+
  geom_line()+
  geom_abline(intercept = 1, slope = 2)
```
